pl.bristleback.server.bristle.integration.spring
Class BristleSpringIntegration

java.lang.Object
  pl.bristleback.server.bristle.integration.spring.BristleSpringIntegration

public final class BristleSpringIntegration
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains application contexts, provided both by the application and Bristleback framework. Also it has equivalent of the Spring application context methods, but using both contexts. All the rules applicable in the Spring application context methods are applicable in this class.

Created on: 2011-01-24 20:14:35

Author:
Wojciech Niemiec

          Creates the new Spring integration object, containing both application and Bristleback Server Spring contexts.

BristleSpringIntegration

public BristleSpringIntegration(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext actualContext,
                                org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext bristlebackFrameworkContext)
Creates the new Spring integration object, containing both application and Bristleback Server Spring contexts.

Parameters:
actualContext - actual application context.
bristlebackFrameworkContext - Bristleback Server internal context.

getBean

public <T> T getBean(java.lang.String beanName,
                     java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
Gets the Spring bean instance with class and name provided as parameters, both actual application context and Bristleback internal context are searched.

Type Parameters:
T - type of bean.
Parameters:
beanName - name of the Spring bean.
beanClass - class of the Spring bean.
Returns:
Spring bean instance either from the actual application context or Bristleback internal context.

getApplicationBean

public <T> T getApplicationBean(java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
Gets the actual application bean instance that uniquely matches the given object type, if any.

Parameters:
beanClass - class of the Spring bean.
Returns:
actual application bean instance that uniquely matches the given object type, if any.

getBeansOfType

public <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> getBeansOfType(java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
Return the bean instances that match the given object type (including subclasses) taken from both actual and Bristleback internal application contexts, judging from either bean definitions or the value of getObjectType in the case of FactoryBeans.

Type Parameters:
T - type of bean.
Parameters:
beanClass - the class or interface to match, or null for all concrete beans
Returns:
a Map with the matching beans, containing the bean names as keys and the corresponding bean instances as values.

getFrameworkBeansOfType

public <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> getFrameworkBeansOfType(java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
Return the bean instances that match the given object type (including subclasses) taken from Bristleback internal application context, judging from either bean definitions or the value of getObjectType in the case of FactoryBeans.

Type Parameters:
T - type of bean.
Parameters:
beanClass - the class or interface to match, or null for all concrete beans
Returns:
a Map with the matching beans, containing the bean names as keys and the corresponding bean instances as values.

getApplicationBeansOfType

public <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> getApplicationBeansOfType(java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
Return the bean instances that match the given object type (including subclasses) taken from actual application context, judging from either bean definitions or the value of getObjectType in the case of FactoryBeans.

Type Parameters:
T - type of bean
Parameters:
beanClass - the class or interface to match, or null for all concrete beans.
Returns:
a Map with the matching beans, containing the bean names as keys and the corresponding bean instances as values.

isSingleton

public boolean isSingleton(java.lang.String beanName)
Checks whether this bean corresponds to a singleton instance. Both actual and Bristleback context are searched.

Parameters:
beanName - name of the Spring bean.
Returns:
whether this bean corresponds to a singleton instance.
